text: We've always had a scarcity of healthcare workers.
With generative AI, we can have an abundance
to make the world a healthier place
in a way we've never been able to do before.
Hippocratic AI is building
a safety-focused large language model for healthcare.
There's a variety of ways
that patients interact with our AI agents
by calling them
- [Rachel] Hi, Jane.
This is Rachel, your AI chronic care manager.
- [Munjal] and walking them through follow-up items
that their doctor might've wanted them to do,
like following up with their chronic disease management
and ensure they get their medications.
- [Rachel] Can you tell me if you've picked up
your new prescription for Digoxin?
- Our large language model,
it's actually a constellation of models
that work together to ensure safety.
Our model is 3.7 trillion parameters together
when we add up all of the pieces of our constellation.
If a surge of calls comes in, spinning up new instances,
it posed a whole set of technical challenges,
and you can't have a voice conversation
that doesn't respond back to you
in about two seconds or less.
We had to do a lot of work together with AWS
in order to ensure we met the latency thresholds we needed
for a fluent and natural conversation.
AWS has this true interest in helping startups win
that really I haven't seen anywhere else.
They were truly passionate about what we were doing
and they were willing to be flexible
really to further our mission and cause.
With generative AI,
we can finally do exactly what we wanted to do
and keep people healthy
instead of just treating them when they're sick.
